body:
I like that he at least allows a little bit of free trade and (at least before the riots) defended some rights of individuals. I'm also glad we finally have someone who's not 100% a puppet for the deep state elites.

I dislike pretty much everything else about him.

post.title: What do you like and dislike about president Trump?

body:
I'm Hispanic so idk I'm not allowed to like him. Orange man bad.


Tbh I don't like him because he gives Americans a bad name with his poor speaking skills. He has shit all experience running a country and has been bankrupt more times than I've fucked. 


What I do like about him is that we're not having our first female president he Shillary. I like his slogan MAGA. And uhm his wife and daughter are hot giving us the sexiest first Lady since the thiccness of the JFK Era.

post.title: What do you like and dislike about president Trump?

body:
I can appreciate how he removed the mandate for Obamacare, signed the Right to Try act which gave terminal patients opportunity to try unapproved drugs. Lower income tax, (i saw more money), defeated ISIS, major prison reform and also redefinition of NAFTA. Pulling out of the WHO after this Coronavirus mess is also a plus. And the Space Force, I think is an awesome opportunity. And he nominated Gorsuch and Kavanaugh,

However, I realized he's not totally for what I believe in.  He placed tariffs on Chinese imports when loosening restrictions on domestic goods should have been the way to go. I see opportunity for him to lower the Federal minimum wage, remove price controls on apartments, and enable what Ted Cruz argued for in the Cruz/Sanders debate. Making any healthcare valid everywhere in the United States. I think he could have pushed for defunding Planned Parenthood, and honestly, given the state right now with the Pandemic, I think he should have pushed for masks harder than he did. To go along with the media narrative, if everyone was in close quarters and yet wearing masks and not getting Kung Flu, then we could have enforced the masks, reopened the economy, and not be in the pit we are now.

As for Israel, I really have no reason to be for him or against him. Moving the embassy from Tel-Aviv to Jerusalem is a PR move, but I can appreciate the significance. I just also wish he would pull our forces out of our bases so that we can a. save money on defenses, b. move it towards the border and c. Let the more socialist countries try and fund their own defenses..

That's my two cents
body_html:
I can appreciate how he removed the mandate for Obamacare, signed the Right to Try act which gave terminal patients opportunity to try unapproved drugs. Lower income tax, (i saw more money), defeated ISIS, major prison reform and also redefinition of NAFTA. Pulling out of the WHO after this Coronavirus mess is also a plus. And the Space Force, I think is an awesome opportunity. And he nominated Gorsuch and Kavanaugh,

However, I realized he's not totally for what I believe in. He placed tariffs on Chinese imports when loosening restrictions on domestic goods should have been the way to go. I see opportunity for him to lower the Federal minimum wage, remove price controls on apartments, and enable what Ted Cruz argued for in the Cruz/Sanders debate. Making any healthcare valid everywhere in the United States. I think he could have pushed for defunding Planned Parenthood, and honestly, given the state right now with the Pandemic, I think he should have pushed for masks harder than he did. To go along with the media narrative, if everyone was in close quarters and yet wearing masks and not getting Kung Flu, then we could have enforced the masks, reopened the economy, and not be in the pit we are now.

As for Israel, I really have no reason to be for him or against him. Moving the embassy from Tel-Aviv to Jerusalem is a PR move, but I can appreciate the significance. I just also wish he would pull our forces out of our bases so that we can a. save money on defenses, b. move it towards the border and c. Let the more socialist countries try and fund their own defenses..

That's my two cents

post.title: What do you like and dislike about president Trump?

body:
you have to realize that the tariffs were a negotiating tactic to bring them to the table. there is nothing inherently wrong with that either. We used to fund government by tariffs only

Read the Art of the deal. you will get a much better understanding of how he negotiates in all things in life. Also read Art of War

I think he could have pushed for defunding Planned Parenthood, and honestly, given the state right now with the Pandemic, I think he should have pushed for masks harder than he did. To go along with the media narrative, if everyone was in close quarters and yet wearing masks and not getting Kung Flu, then we could have enforced the masks, reopened the economy, and not be in the pit we are now.

As for Israel, I really have no reason to be for him or against him. Moving the embassy from Tel-Aviv to Jerusalem is a PR move, but I can appreciate the significance. I just also wish he would pull our forces out of our bases so that we can a. save money on defenses, b. move it towards the border and c. Let the more socialist countries try and fund their own defenses..

That's my two cents

post.title: What do you like and dislike about president Trump?

body:
"He has shit all experience running a country and has been bankrupt more times than I've fucked"

So my first comment was what president before had good experience running a country much less a state or large worldwide business empire? i would argue instead that Trump has shown us what a president can do for the american people when past presidents have not done shit but been a part of the club. We should hold all future candidates up to this standard. 

As for the bankruptcies that is not that big of a deal overall when you consider how many different companies he has ran successfully. His overall failure rate is pretty low in comparison. By any means that is an incredible accomplishment as well as becoming a billionaire TWICE
body_html:
"He has shit all experience running a country and has been bankrupt more times than I've fucked"

So my first comment was what president before had good experience running a country much less a state or large worldwide business empire? i would argue instead that Trump has shown us what a president can do for the american people when past presidents have not done shit but been a part of the club. We should hold all future candidates up to this standard.

As for the bankruptcies that is not that big of a deal overall when you consider how many different companies he has ran successfully. His overall failure rate is pretty low in comparison. By any means that is an incredible accomplishment as well as becoming a billionaire TWICE

post.title: What do you like and dislike about president Trump?

body:
I should have said he has no political experience because that's what I meant. Not trying to shift my argument but rather clarify. And as for being a billionaire twice? Yeah that's an accomplishment but it's overshadowed by his "small loan of a million dollars." If most folks can get a 1m loan there'd be more million and billionaires. I'm not saying it's easy. He had to have some business sense but it's like having financial training wheels. None of this "pull yourself up by your bootstraps" nonsense applies to Donny. 


As for the bankruptcy not being a big deal because of his other successes that makes no sense to me as he's always had the backing of his family's fortune as a safety net when he goofs. Then we run into some of his businesses of being essentially slum lord or a scam artist (Trump University).
body_html:
I should have said he has no political experience because that's what I meant. Not trying to shift my argument but rather clarify. And as for being a billionaire twice? Yeah that's an accomplishment but it's overshadowed by his "small loan of a million dollars." If most folks can get a 1m loan there'd be more million and billionaires. I'm not saying it's easy. He had to have some business sense but it's like having financial training wheels. None of this "pull yourself up by your bootstraps" nonsense applies to Donny.

As for the bankruptcy not being a big deal because of his other successes that makes no sense to me as he's always had the backing of his family's fortune as a safety net when he goofs. Then we run into some of his businesses of being essentially slum lord or a scam artist (Trump University).

post.title: What do you like and dislike about president Trump?

body:
He really has not had that backing. He is way more wealthy than his family ever was. He has a very interesting life story that is seriously worth learning about. 

As for the million. I had this discussion with someone else. If you know much about N.Y. City  that is nothing. that would be like me getting 100k where I am to start a business. He could have gotten financing elsewhere if necessary. He didn't need to. That should not be held against him though. He still took that initial investment and made himself a multi billionaire. That is wildly successful and I doubt 1 in 10 million could do the same. And he did it twice
body_html:
He really has not had that backing. He is way more wealthy than his family ever was. He has a very interesting life story that is seriously worth learning about.

As for the million. I had this discussion with someone else. If you know much about N.Y. City that is nothing. that would be like me getting 100k where I am to start a business. He could have gotten financing elsewhere if necessary. He didn't need to. That should not be held against him though. He still took that initial investment and made himself a multi billionaire. That is wildly successful and I doubt 1 in 10 million could do the same. And he did it twice

post.title: What do you like and dislike about president Trump?

body:
I dislike how he communicates using Twitter, has insulted NATO allies, insulted Denmark in particular, politicized mask wearing, raised spending, failed to sufficiently vet Cavanaugh, alienated Hispanics, and imposed travel bans on Muslims (long before the virus).

I like how he isn’t Hillary Clinton.
body_html:
I dislike how he communicates using Twitter, has insulted NATO allies, insulted Denmark in particular, politicized mask wearing, raised spending, failed to sufficiently vet Cavanaugh, alienated Hispanics, and imposed travel bans on Muslims (long before the virus).

I like how he isn’t Hillary Clinton.

parent.body:
I can appreciate how he removed the mandate for Obamacare, signed the Right to Try act which gave terminal patients opportunity to try unapproved drugs. Lower income tax, (i saw more money), defeated ISIS, major prison reform and also redefinition of NAFTA. Pulling out of the WHO after this Coronavirus mess is also a plus. And the Space Force, I think is an awesome opportunity. And he nominated Gorsuch and Kavanaugh,

However, I realized he's not totally for what I believe in.  He placed tariffs on Chinese imports when loosening restrictions on domestic goods should have been the way to go. I see opportunity for him to lower the Federal minimum wage, remove price controls on apartments, and enable what Ted Cruz argued for in the Cruz/Sanders debate. Making any healthcare valid everywhere in the United States. I think he could have pushed for defunding Planned Parenthood, and honestly, given the state right now with the Pandemic, I think he should have pushed for masks harder than he did. To go along with the media narrative, if everyone was in close quarters and yet wearing masks and not getting Kung Flu, then we could have enforced the masks, reopened the economy, and not be in the pit we are now.

As for Israel, I really have no reason to be for him or against him. Moving the embassy from Tel-Aviv to Jerusalem is a PR move, but I can appreciate the significance. I just also wish he would pull our forces out of our bases so that we can a. save money on defenses, b. move it towards the border and c. Let the more socialist countries try and fund their own defenses..

That's my two cents
parent.body_html:
I can appreciate how he removed the mandate for Obamacare, signed the Right to Try act which gave terminal patients opportunity to try unapproved drugs. Lower income tax, (i saw more money), defeated ISIS, major prison reform and also redefinition of NAFTA. Pulling out of the WHO after this Coronavirus mess is also a plus. And the Space Force, I think is an awesome opportunity. And he nominated Gorsuch and Kavanaugh,

However, I realized he's not totally for what I believe in. He placed tariffs on Chinese imports when loosening restrictions on domestic goods should have been the way to go. I see opportunity for him to lower the Federal minimum wage, remove price controls on apartments, and enable what Ted Cruz argued for in the Cruz/Sanders debate. Making any healthcare valid everywhere in the United States. I think he could have pushed for defunding Planned Parenthood, and honestly, given the state right now with the Pandemic, I think he should have pushed for masks harder than he did. To go along with the media narrative, if everyone was in close quarters and yet wearing masks and not getting Kung Flu, then we could have enforced the masks, reopened the economy, and not be in the pit we are now.

As for Israel, I really have no reason to be for him or against him. Moving the embassy from Tel-Aviv to Jerusalem is a PR move, but I can appreciate the significance. I just also wish he would pull our forces out of our bases so that we can a. save money on defenses, b. move it towards the border and c. Let the more socialist countries try and fund their own defenses..

That's my two cents

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

🥾 Breaking these rules will result in posts being kicked and possibly an exile.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.
